name: Dinner Tonight: Butternut Squash Baked Risotto
description: There is a lot of fear and hype surrounding risotto, considering it's basically just a bunch of rice. Most of these risotto fears, though, are unfounded. If you let it cook slowly and add the liquid little by little, the results are usually good and sometimes sublime.
recipeIngredient: 1 medium butternut squash, peeled and cut into medium dice, about 4 cups
1 bunch kale, stems removed and leaves cut into 1/2-inch thick strips

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Farenheit. In a large dutch oven, heat the oil over medium until shimmering. Add shallots and cook until soft, about 3 minutes, the add the garlic and cook for an additional minute. Add the rice and stir well to coat in the oil. Toast until opaque, about 3 minutes, then add the wine and allow it to absorb into the rice.

Add the squash, broth, and kale, and season to taste with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, cover tightly, and transfer to the oven. Bake until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Serve with grated Parmesan.
